alert.note: Alert for Cascade County below 5000ft; Eastern Glacier, Western Toole, and Central Pondera; Eastern Pondera and Eastern Teton; Eastern Toole and Liberty; Hill County; Judith Basin County and Judith Gap; Little Belt and Highwood Mountains; Northern High Plains; Southern High Plains; Western and Central Chouteau County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 06 at 2:46AM MST until January 06 at 12:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MST TODAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch and ice accumulations around a light glaze. * WHERE...Portions of central and north central Montana. * WHEN...Until Noon MST today. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact this morning`s commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Areas of light snow will continue to spread north over North Central Montana early this morning, possibly mixing with freezing rain or drizzle at times through the late morning hours. Although snow accumulations will be fairly light, the potential for freezing rain or drizzle could make some road surfaces particularly icy. Snow will mix with or change over to rain gradually from the south later this morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website.
